title: What You Can Do to Protect Your Dependent-Care FSA Cash
sub_head: With relief bills stalled, many holders with leftover funds are in limbo—but some options exist
body:
I have a dependent-care flexible spending account, but since most after-school programs and summer camps didn’t take place this year, I have a big balance left in my account for 2020. What are my options?

The bottom line
Flexible spending accounts (FSAs) put aside pretax dollars for certain expenses—in this case qualified child-care and elder-care costs. These accounts are use-it-or-lose-it, so unless you find expenses to claim, you’ll forfeit the balance to your employer. However, there may be some relief in sight regarding your 2020 dollars: Employers can choose to offer a grace period, allowing employees to claim expenses incurred in early 2021. And the House and Senate Covid-19 aid bills currently stalled in Congress have provisions allowing workers to roll all or most of their 2020 balances into 2021.
